subQuestion.question: (3r − 2k)3+ (3r + 2k)3
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b \right)^3 = a^3 + b^3 + 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2 ; \left( a - b \right)^3 = a^3 - b^3 - 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2\]\[\left( 3r - 2k \right)^3 + \left( 3r + 2k \right)^3 \]\[ = \left( 3r \right)^3 - \left( 2k \right)^3 - 3 \times \left( 3r \right)^2 \times 2k + 3 \times 3r \times \left( 2k \right)^2 + \left( 3r \right)^3 + \left( 2k \right)^3 + 3 \times \left( 3r \right)^2 \times 2k + 3 \times 3r \times \left( 2k \right)^2 \]\[ = 27 r^3 - 8 k^3 - 54 r^2 k + 36r k^2 + 27 r^3 + 8 k^3 + 54 r^2 k + 36r k^2 \]\[ = 54 r^3 + 72r k^2\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify.

subQuestion.question: (4a − 3)3− (4a + 3)3
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left(a + b \right)^3 = a^3 + b^3 + 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2 ; \left(a - b \right)^3 = a^3 - b^3 - 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2\]\[\ \left(4a - 3 \right)^3 - \left(4a + 3 \right)^3 \]\[ =  \left(4a \right)^3 - \left(3 \right)^3 - 3 \times  \left(4a \right)^2  \times 3 + 3 \times 4a \times  \left(3 \right)^2 - \left\{\left(4a \right)^3 + \left(3 \right)^3 + 3 \times \left( 4a \right)^2 \times 3 + 3 \times 4a \times \left(3 \right)^2 \right\}\]\[= 64 a^3 - 27 - 144 a^2  + 108 - 64 a^3 - 27 - 144 a^2 - 108\]\[= -288 a^2 - 54\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify.

subQuestion.question: (5x − 7y)3+ (5x + 7y)3
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b \right)^3 = a^3 + b^3 + 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2 ; \left( a - b \right)^3 = a^3 - b^3 - 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2\]\[\   \left( 5x - 7y \right)^3  +  \left( 5x + 7y \right)^3 \]\[ = \left( 5x \right)^3  -  \left( 7y \right)^3  - 3 \times  \left( 5x \right)^2  \times 7y + 3 \times 5x \times  \left( 7y \right)^2  +  \left( 5x \right)^3  +  \left( 7y \right)^3  + 3 \times  \left( 5x \right)^2  \times \left( 7y \right) + 3 \times 5x \times  \left( 7y \right)^2 \]\[ = 125 x^3  - 343 y^3  - 525 x^2 y + 735x y^2  + 125 x^3  + 343 y^3  + 525 x^2 y + 735x y^2 \]\[ = 250 x^3  + 1470x y^2\]

subQuestion.question: (2p + q +5)2
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b + c \right)^2  =  a^2  +  b^2  +  c^2  + 2ab + 2bc + 2ca\]\[\   \left( 2p + q + 5 \right)^2 \]\[ =  \left( 2p \right)^2  +  \left( q \right)^2  +  \left( 5 \right)^2  + 2 \times 2p \times q + 2 \times q \times 5 + 2 \times 5 \times 2p\]\[ = 4 p^2  +  q^2  + 25 + 4pq + 10q + 20p\]

questions.questionsTitle: Expand.

subQuestion.question: (m + 2n + 3r)2
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b + c \right)^2  =  a^2  +  b^2  +  c^2  + 2ab + 2bc + 2ac\]\[\   \left( m + 2n + 3r \right)^2 \]\[ =  \left( m \right)^2  +  \left( 2n \right)^2  +  \left( 3r \right)^2  + 2 \times m \times 2n + 2 \times 2n \times 3r + 2 \times m \times 3r \]\[ =  m^2  + 4 n^2  + 9 r^2  + 4mn + 12nr + 6mr\]

subQuestion.question: (7m − 3n − 4k)2
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b + c \right)^2  =  a^2  +  b^2  +  c^2  + 2ab + 2bc + 2ac\]\[\   \left( 7m - 3n - 4k \right)^2 \]\[ =  \left( 7m \right)^2  + \left( - 3 n^2 \right) +  \left( - 4k \right)^2  + 2 \times 7m \times \left( - 3n \right) + 2 \times \left( - 3n \right) \times \left( - 4k \right) + 2 \times 7m \times \left( - 4k \right)\]\[ = 49 m^2  + 9 n^2  + 16 k^2  - 42mn + 24nk - 56km\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify.

subQuestion.question: (x − 2y +3)2+ (x + 2y − 3)2
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b + c \right)^2  =  a^2  +  b^2  +  c^2  + 2ab + 2bc + 2ca\]\[\   \left( x - 2y + 3 \right)^2  +  \left( x + 2y - 3 \right)^2 \]\[ =  \left( x \right)^2  +  \left( - 2y \right)^2  +  \left( 3 \right)^2  + 2 \times x \times \left( - 2y \right) + 2 \times \left( - 2y \right) \times 3 + 2 \times 3 \times x +  \left( x \right)^2  +  \left( 2y \right)^2  +  \left( - 3 \right)^2  + 2 \times x \times 2y + 2 \times \left( 2y \right) \times \left( - 3 \right) + 2 \times \left( - 3 \right) \times x\]\[ =  x^2  + 4 y^2  + 9 - 4xy - 12y + 6x +  x^2  + 4 y^2  + 9 + 4xy - 12y - 6x\]\[ = 2 x^2  + 8 y^2  + 18 - 24y\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify.
Simplify.

subQuestion.question: (7a − 6b + 5c)2+ (7a + 6b − 5c)2
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b + c \right)^2  =  a^2  +  b^2  +  c^2  + 2ab + 2bc + 2ca\]\[\  \left( 7a - 6b + 5c \right)^2  +  \left( 7a + 6b - 5c \right)^2 \]\[ =  \left( 7a \right)^2  +  \left( - 6b \right)^2  +  \left( 5c \right)^2  + 2 \times 7a \times \left( - 6b \right) + 2 \times \left( - 6b \right) \times 5c + 2 \times 5c \times 7a +  \left( 7a \right)^2  +  \left( 6b \right)^2  +  \left( - 5c \right)^2  + 2 \times 7a \times 6b + 2 \times 6b \times \left( - 5c \right) + 2 \times \left( - 5c \right) \times 7a\]\[ = 49 a^2  + 36 b^2  + 25 c^2 - 84ab - 60bc + 70ca + 49 a^2  + 36 b^2  + 25 c^2  + 84ab - 60bc - 70ca\]\[ = 98 a^2  + 72 b^2  + 50 c^2  - 120bc\]

questions.questionsTitle: If 15 workers can build a wall in 48 hours, how many workers will be required to do the same work in 30 hours?

subQuestion.question: If 15 workers can build a wall in 48 hours, how many workers will be required to do the same work in 30 hours?
subQuestion.ans: Let n represent the number of workers building the wall and t represent the time required.Since the number of workers varies inversely with the time required to build the wall.∴ `n ∝ 1/t`∴ n = `"k" = 1/t`where k is the constant of variation∴ n × t = k   …(i)15 workers can build a wall in 48 hours,i.e., when n = 15, t = 48∴ Substituting n = 15 and t = 48 in (i), we getn × t = k15 × 48 = k∴ k = 720Substituting k = 720 in (i), we getn × t = k∴ n × t = 720    …(ii)This is the equation of variation.Now, we have to find the number of workers required to do the same work in 30 hours.i.e., when t = 30, n = ?∴ Substituting t = 30 in (ii), we getn × t = 720∴ n × 30 = 720∴ n = `720/30`∴ n = 24∴ 24 workers will be required to build the wall in 30 hours.

questions.questionsTitle: 120 bags of half litre milk can be filled by a machine within 3 minutes find the time to fill such 1800 bags?

subQuestion.question: 120 bags of half litre milk can be filled by a machine within 3 minutes find the time to fill such 1800 bags?
subQuestion.ans: The time required to fill the milk bags varies directly with the time required to fill the bags.Let the number of minutes be x and the number of bags be y.Here, x varies directly as y, i.e., x α y.∴ x = ky, where k is the constant of variationWhen x = 3, y = 120∴ 3 = k × 120⇒ k = \[\frac{3}{120} = \frac{1}{40}\]So, the equation of variation is \[x = \frac{1}{40}y\]When y = 1800,\[x = \frac{1}{40} \times 1800 = 45\]Thus, the time required to fill 1800 bags with milk is 45 minutes.

questions.questionsTitle: A car with speed 60 km/hr  takes 8 hours to travel some distance. What should be the increase in the speed if the same distance is to be covered in 7\[\frac{1}{2}\] hours?

subQuestion.question: A car with speed 60 km/hr  takes 8 hours to travel some distance. What should be the increase in the speed if the same distance is to be covered in 7\[\frac{1}{2}\] hours?
subQuestion.ans: The speed of the car is inversely proportional to the time taken by the car to travel the distance.Let the speed of the car be s and the time taken by the car to travel the distance be t.Here, s varies inversely as t, i.e., `s  α  1/t`.∴ \[s = \frac{k}{t}\] , where k is constant of variation⇒ s × t = kWhen s = 60, t = 8.∴ k = 60 × 8 = 480So, the equation of variation is st = 480.When t = \[7\frac{1}{2}\] h = \[\frac{15}{2}\] h,\[s \times \frac{15}{2} = 480\]⇒ \[s = \frac{480 \times 2}{15}\] = 64 km/h∴ Increase in the speed = 64 − 60 = 4 km/hThus, the increase in the speed of the car is 4 km/h.

questions.questionsTitle: A shopkeeper decides to sell a certain item at a certain price. He tags the price on the item by increasing the decided price by 25%. While selling the item, he offers 20% discount. Find how many more or less percent he gets on the decided price.

subQuestion.question: A shopkeeper decides to sell a certain item at a certain price. He tags the price on the item by increasing the decided price by 25%. While selling the item, he offers 20% discount. Find how many more or less percent he gets on the decided price.
subQuestion.ans: Let the decided price of the item be ₹ 100.∴ Marked price of the item = ₹ 100 + 25% of ₹ 100= ₹ 100 + ₹ 25= ₹ 125Discount on the item = 20% of ₹ 125= \[\frac{20}{100} \times 125\]= ₹ 25∴ Selling price of the item = Marked price of the item − Discount on the item= ₹ 125 − ₹ 25= ₹ 100Since the decided price of the item is same as the selling price of the item so the shopkeeper neither makes any profit nor any loss on selling the item.Thus, the shopkeeper gets 0% on the decided price.

questions.questionsTitle: Rafique sold flowers worth ₹ 15,000 by giving 4% commission to the agent. Find the commission he paid. Find the amount received by Rafique.

subQuestion.question: Rafique sold flowers worth ₹ 15,000 by giving 4% commission to the agent. Find the commission he paid. Find the amount received by Rafique.
subQuestion.ans: Selling price of the flowers = ₹ 15,000Commission rate = 4%Commission paid to the agent = 4% of ₹ 15,000= \[\frac{4}{100} \times 15000\]= ₹ 600So, the commission paid by Rafique is ₹ 600.∴ Amount received by the Rafique= Selling price of the flowers − Commission paid to the agent= ₹ 15,000 − ₹ 600= ₹ 14,400Thus, the amount received by Rafique is ₹ 14,400.

questions.questionsTitle: If base of a parallelogram is 18 cm and its height is 11 cm, find its area.

subQuestion.question: If base of a parallelogram is 18 cm and its height is 11 cm, find its area.
subQuestion.ans: Given, base = 18 cm, height = 11 cmArea of a parallelogram = `"Base" xx "height"`= `18 xx 11`= 198 cm²∴ Area of the parallelogram is 198 sq.cm.

questions.questionsTitle: Area of a parallelogram is 83.2 sq cm. If its height is 6.4 cm, find the length of its base.

subQuestion.question: Area of a parallelogram is 83.2 sq cm. If its height is 6.4 cm, find the length of its base.
subQuestion.ans: Area of a parallelogram = 83.2 sq.cm.Height = 6.4 cm, Base = ?We know that,Area of a parallelogram = Base × height83.2 = Base × 6.4`(83.2 xx 10)/(6.4 xx 10)` = BaseBase = `832/64`Base = `104/8`∴ Base = 13 cmHence, Base of a parallelogram is 13 cm.

subQuestion.question: Lengths of the diagonals of a rhombus are 15 cm and 24 cm, find its area.
subQuestion.ans: Given:d1 = 15 cmd2 = 23 cmTo find area of rhombus.Area of rhombus =  `1/2 xx ("d"1 xx "d"2 )`⇒ Area of rhombus = `1/2 xx 15 xx 24` = 180 cm2

questions.questionsTitle: Lengths of the diagonals of a rhombus are 16.5 cm and 14.2 cm, find its area.

subQuestion.ans: Lengths of the diagonals of a rhombus are 16.5 cm and 14.2 cm.Area of rhombus = `1/2 xx "product of lengths of diagonals"`Area of rhombus = `1/2 xx 16.5 xx 14.2`= 16.5 × 7.1= 117.15 cm2∴ The area of the rhombus is 117.15 sq.

questions.questionsTitle: If perimeter of a rhombus is 100 cm and length of one diagonal is 48 cm, what is the area of the quadrilateral?

subQuestion.question: If perimeter of a rhombus is 100 cm and length of one diagonal is 48 cm, what is the area of the quadrilateral?
subQuestion.ans: Perimeter of the rhombus = 100 cm⇒ `4  xx` side = 100⇒ side = `100/4` = 25 cmThus, each side of the rhombus = 25 cm.Diagonals of a rhombus are perpandicular bisector of each other.So, AO = OC = `48/2` = 24 cmIn Δ AOB,We apply Pythagoras theorem,AO² + OB² = AB²⇒ 24²  + OB²  = 25²⇒ OB²  = 625 - 576 = 49⇒ OB = 7 cmSo, DB = `2 xx "OB" = 2 xx 7` = 14 cmArea of rhombus = `1/2 xx` (product of diagonal)= `1/2 xx 14 xx 48`= 336 cm²

questions.questionsTitle: Look at the measures shown in the adjacent figure and find the area of ☐ PQRS.

subQuestion.question: Look at the measures shown in the adjacent figure and find the area of ☐ PQRS.
subQuestion.ans: In triangle PSR,Applying Pythagoras theorem,PS²  + SR²  = PR²⇒ 36²  + 15²  = PR²⇒ PR²  = 1296 + 225⇒ PR² = 1521⇒ PR = `sqrt[1521]`⇒ PR = 39 mArea of triangle PSR = `1/2 xx 15 xx 36` = 270 m²In triangle PQR,by using Heron's formula,Let a = 56, b = 25, c = 39So,s = `(a + b + c)/2`s `= (56 + 25 + 39)/2`s = 60Area =`sqrt[60 ( 60 - 56) (60 -25) (60 -39)]`= `sqrt[60 xx 4 xx 35 xx 21]`= `sqrt[176400]`= 420 m²Area of PQRS = Area of triangle PSR + Area of triangle PQR= 270 + 420= 690 m2

questions.questionsTitle: Some measures are given in the adjacent figure, find the area of ☐ABCD.

subQuestion.question: Some measures are given in the adjacent figure, find the area of ☐ABCD.
subQuestion.ans: A(☐ABCD) = A(∆BAD) + A(∆BDC)In ∆BAD, m∠BAD = 90°, l(AB) = 40m, l(AD) = 9mA(∆BAD) = `1/2 xx "product of sides forming the right angle"`= `1/2 xx l("AB") xx l("AD")`= `1/2 xx 40 xx 9`= 180 sq.mIn ∆BDC, l(BT) = 13m, l(CD) = 60mA(∆BDC) = `1/2 "base" xx "height"`= `1/2 xx l("CD") xx l("BT")`= `1/2 xx 60 xx 13`= 390 sq.

questions.questionsTitle: Find the areas of the given plot. (All measures are in metres.)

subQuestion.question: Find the areas of the given plot. (All measures are in metres.)
subQuestion.ans: In given Figure,PA = 30 m, AB = 30 m BC = 30 m, CS = 60 m, QA = 50 m, RC = 25 m, TB = 30 m.A(ΔPAQ) = `1/2` × PA × QA= `1/2 xx 30 xx 50`∴ A(ΔPAQ) = 750 m2......(1)A(ΔRCS) = `1/2` × CS × RC= `1/2 xx 60 xx 25`∴ A(ΔRCS) = 750 m2......(2)∵ P − A − B − C − S∴ PS = PA + AB + BC + CS= 30 + 30 + 30 + 60∴ PS = 150 mAlso, AC = AB + BC = 30 + 30 = 60 mAlso, AC = AB + BC = 30 + 30 = 60 mA(ΔPTS) = `1/2` × PS × TB= `1/2 xx 150 xx 30 = 2250`∴ A(ΔPTS) = 2250 m2.....(3)QA || RC∴ `square`QRCA is a Trapezium.A(`square`QRCA) = `1/2 xx ("QA + RC") xx "AC"`= `1/2 xx (50 + 25) xx 60 = 1/2 xx 75 xx 60`∴ A(`square`QRCA) = 2250 m2......(4)Area of given Plot = A(ΔPAQ) + A(`square`QRCA) + A(ΔRCS) + A(ΔPTS)= 750 + 2250 + 750 + 2250    .......[From (1), (2), (3) and (4)]∴ Area of the given Plot = 6000 m2

questions.questionsTitle: Find the areas of the given plot. (All measures are in metres.)

subQuestion.question: Find the areas of the given plot. (All measures are in metres.)
subQuestion.ans: In ∆ABE, m∠BAE = 90°, l(AB) = 24 m, l(BE) = 30 m∴ [l(BE)]2= [l(AB)]2+ [l(AE)]2…[Pythagoras theorem]∴ (30)2= (24)2+ [l(AE)]2∴ 900 = 576 + [l(AE)]2∴ [l(AE)]2= 900 – 576∴ [l(AE)]2= 324∴ l(AE) = `sqrt324`= 18 m …[Taking square root of both sides]A(∆ABE) = `(1/2)` x product of sides forming the right angle= `(1/2) xx l("AE") xx l("AB")`= `(1/2) xx 18 xx 24`= 216 sq.

questions.questionsTitle: Radius of a circle with centre O is 25 cm. Find the distance of a chord from the centre if length of the chord is 48 cm.

subQuestion.question: Radius of a circle with centre O is 25 cm. Find the distance of a chord from the centre if length of the chord is 48 cm.
subQuestion.ans: seg OP ⊥ chord CD            …[Given]∴ l(PD) = `1/2 l(CD)`           …[Perpendicular drawn from the centre of a circle to its chord bisects the chord]∴ l(PD) = `1/2 xx 48`           …[∵ l(CD) = 48 cm]∴ l(PD) = 24 cmIn ΔOPD,∠ OPD = 90°∴ [l(OD)]2= [l(OP)]2+ [l(PD)]2… [Pythagoras theorem]∴ (25)2= [l(OP)]2+ (24)2∴ (25)2− (24)2= [l(OP)]2∴ 625 − 576= [l(OP)]2∴ 49= [l(OP)]2∴ l(OP) = `sqrt(49)`           …[Taking square root of both sides]∴ l(OP) = 7 cm∴ The distance of the chord from the centre of the circle is 7 cm.

questions.questionsTitle: O is centre of the circle. Find the length of radius, if the chord of length 24 cm is at a distance of 9 cm from the centre of the circle.

subQuestion.question: O is centre of the circle. Find the length of radius, if the chord of length 24 cm is at a distance of 9 cm from the centre of the circle.
subQuestion.ans: Join OA.Let the perpendicular drawn from point O to the chord AB be P.We know that the perpendicular drawn from the centre of the circle to the chord bisects the chord.So, AP = `"AB"/2 = 24/2` = 12 cmIn Δ OPA,We apply the Pythagoras theorem,OP2+ AP2= OA2⇒ 92+ 122= OA2⇒ OA2= 81 + 144 = 225⇒ OA = `sqrt225` 15 cmHence, the radius of the circle is 15 cm.

subQuestion.ans: To find the cube root of 729, let us factorise 729 first.3729324338132739331729 = 3 × 3 × 3 × 3 × 3 × 3\[\sqrt[3]{729} = \sqrt[3]{3\times3\times3\times3\times3\times3}\]\[\Rightarrow\sqrt[3]{729} = \sqrt[3]{{(3\times3\times3)}\times{(3\times3\times3)}}\]\[\Rightarrow\sqrt[3]{729} = 3\times3\]\[\Rightarrow\sqrt[3]{729} = 9\]Hence, the cube root of 729 is 9.

subQuestion.question: (3r − 2k)3+ (3r + 2k)3
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b \right)^3 = a^3 + b^3 + 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2 ; \left( a - b \right)^3 = a^3 - b^3 - 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2\]\[\left( 3r - 2k \right)^3 + \left( 3r + 2k \right)^3 \]\[ = \left( 3r \right)^3 - \left( 2k \right)^3 - 3 \times \left( 3r \right)^2 \times 2k + 3 \times 3r \times \left( 2k \right)^2 + \left( 3r \right)^3 + \left( 2k \right)^3 + 3 \times \left( 3r \right)^2 \times 2k + 3 \times 3r \times \left( 2k \right)^2 \]\[ = 27 r^3 - 8 k^3 - 54 r^2 k + 36r k^2 + 27 r^3 + 8 k^3 + 54 r^2 k + 36r k^2 \]\[ = 54 r^3 + 72r k^2\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify.

subQuestion.question: (4a − 3)3− (4a + 3)3
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left(a + b \right)^3 = a^3 + b^3 + 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2 ; \left(a - b \right)^3 = a^3 - b^3 - 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2\]\[\ \left(4a - 3 \right)^3 - \left(4a + 3 \right)^3 \]\[ =  \left(4a \right)^3 - \left(3 \right)^3 - 3 \times  \left(4a \right)^2  \times 3 + 3 \times 4a \times  \left(3 \right)^2 - \left\{\left(4a \right)^3 + \left(3 \right)^3 + 3 \times \left( 4a \right)^2 \times 3 + 3 \times 4a \times \left(3 \right)^2 \right\}\]\[= 64 a^3 - 27 - 144 a^2  + 108 - 64 a^3 - 27 - 144 a^2 - 108\]\[= -288 a^2 - 54\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify.

subQuestion.question: (5x − 7y)3+ (5x + 7y)3
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b \right)^3 = a^3 + b^3 + 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2 ; \left( a - b \right)^3 = a^3 - b^3 - 3 a^2 b + 3a b^2\]\[\   \left( 5x - 7y \right)^3  +  \left( 5x + 7y \right)^3 \]\[ = \left( 5x \right)^3  -  \left( 7y \right)^3  - 3 \times  \left( 5x \right)^2  \times 7y + 3 \times 5x \times  \left( 7y \right)^2  +  \left( 5x \right)^3  +  \left( 7y \right)^3  + 3 \times  \left( 5x \right)^2  \times \left( 7y \right) + 3 \times 5x \times  \left( 7y \right)^2 \]\[ = 125 x^3  - 343 y^3  - 525 x^2 y + 735x y^2  + 125 x^3  + 343 y^3  + 525 x^2 y + 735x y^2 \]\[ = 250 x^3  + 1470x y^2\]

subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b + c \right)^2  =  a^2  +  b^2  +  c^2  + 2ab + 2bc + 2ca\]\[\   \left( 2p + q + 5 \right)^2 \]\[ =  \left( 2p \right)^2  +  \left( q \right)^2  +  \left( 5 \right)^2  + 2 \times 2p \times q + 2 \times q \times 5 + 2 \times 5 \times 2p\]\[ = 4 p^2  +  q^2  + 25 + 4pq + 10q + 20p\]

subQuestion.question: (m + 2n + 3r)2
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b + c \right)^2  =  a^2  +  b^2  +  c^2  + 2ab + 2bc + 2ac\]\[\   \left( m + 2n + 3r \right)^2 \]\[ =  \left( m \right)^2  +  \left( 2n \right)^2  +  \left( 3r \right)^2  + 2 \times m \times 2n + 2 \times 2n \times 3r + 2 \times m \times 3r \]\[ =  m^2  + 4 n^2  + 9 r^2  + 4mn + 12nr + 6mr\]

subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b + c \right)^2  =  a^2  +  b^2  +  c^2  + 2ab + 2bc + 2ac\]\[\   \left( 7m - 3n - 4k \right)^2 \]\[ =  \left( 7m \right)^2  + \left( - 3 n^2 \right) +  \left( - 4k \right)^2  + 2 \times 7m \times \left( - 3n \right) + 2 \times \left( - 3n \right) \times \left( - 4k \right) + 2 \times 7m \times \left( - 4k \right)\]\[ = 49 m^2  + 9 n^2  + 16 k^2  - 42mn + 24nk - 56km\]

subQuestion.question: (x − 2y +3)2+ (x + 2y − 3)2
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b + c \right)^2  =  a^2  +  b^2  +  c^2  + 2ab + 2bc + 2ca\]\[\   \left( x - 2y + 3 \right)^2  +  \left( x + 2y - 3 \right)^2 \]\[ =  \left( x \right)^2  +  \left( - 2y \right)^2  +  \left( 3 \right)^2  + 2 \times x \times \left( - 2y \right) + 2 \times \left( - 2y \right) \times 3 + 2 \times 3 \times x +  \left( x \right)^2  +  \left( 2y \right)^2  +  \left( - 3 \right)^2  + 2 \times x \times 2y + 2 \times \left( 2y \right) \times \left( - 3 \right) + 2 \times \left( - 3 \right) \times x\]\[ =  x^2  + 4 y^2  + 9 - 4xy - 12y + 6x +  x^2  + 4 y^2  + 9 + 4xy - 12y - 6x\]\[ = 2 x^2  + 8 y^2  + 18 - 24y\]

subQuestion.question: (7a − 6b + 5c)2+ (7a + 6b − 5c)2
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,\[\left( a + b + c \right)^2  =  a^2  +  b^2  +  c^2  + 2ab + 2bc + 2ca\]\[\  \left( 7a - 6b + 5c \right)^2  +  \left( 7a + 6b - 5c \right)^2 \]\[ =  \left( 7a \right)^2  +  \left( - 6b \right)^2  +  \left( 5c \right)^2  + 2 \times 7a \times \left( - 6b \right) + 2 \times \left( - 6b \right) \times 5c + 2 \times 5c \times 7a +  \left( 7a \right)^2  +  \left( 6b \right)^2  +  \left( - 5c \right)^2  + 2 \times 7a \times 6b + 2 \times 6b \times \left( - 5c \right) + 2 \times \left( - 5c \right) \times 7a\]\[ = 49 a^2  + 36 b^2  + 25 c^2 - 84ab - 60bc + 70ca + 49 a^2  + 36 b^2  + 25 c^2  + 84ab - 60bc - 70ca\]\[ = 98 a^2  + 72 b^2  + 50 c^2  - 120bc\]

questions.questionsTitle: If 15 workers can build a wall in 48 hours, how many workers will be required to do the same work in 30 hours?

subQuestion.question: If 15 workers can build a wall in 48 hours, how many workers will be required to do the same work in 30 hours?
subQuestion.ans: Let n represent the number of workers building the wall and t represent the time required.Since the number of workers varies inversely with the time required to build the wall.∴ `n ∝ 1/t`∴ n = `"k" = 1/t`where k is the constant of variation∴ n × t = k   …(i)15 workers can build a wall in 48 hours,i.e., when n = 15, t = 48∴ Substituting n = 15 and t = 48 in (i), we getn × t = k15 × 48 = k∴ k = 720Substituting k = 720 in (i), we getn × t = k∴ n × t = 720    …(ii)This is the equation of variation.Now, we have to find the number of workers required to do the same work in 30 hours.i.e., when t = 30, n = ?∴ Substituting t = 30 in (ii), we getn × t = 720∴ n × 30 = 720∴ n = `720/30`∴ n = 24∴ 24 workers will be required to build the wall in 30 hours.

questions.questionsTitle: 120 bags of half litre milk can be filled by a machine within 3 minutes find the time to fill such 1800 bags?

subQuestion.question: 120 bags of half litre milk can be filled by a machine within 3 minutes find the time to fill such 1800 bags?
subQuestion.ans: The time required to fill the milk bags varies directly with the time required to fill the bags.Let the number of minutes be x and the number of bags be y.Here, x varies directly as y, i.e., x α y.∴ x = ky, where k is the constant of variationWhen x = 3, y = 120∴ 3 = k × 120⇒ k = \[\frac{3}{120} = \frac{1}{40}\]So, the equation of variation is \[x = \frac{1}{40}y\]When y = 1800,\[x = \frac{1}{40} \times 1800 = 45\]Thus, the time required to fill 1800 bags with milk is 45 minutes.

questions.questionsTitle: A car with speed 60 km/hr  takes 8 hours to travel some distance. What should be the increase in the speed if the same distance is to be covered in 7\[\frac{1}{2}\] hours?

subQuestion.question: A car with speed 60 km/hr  takes 8 hours to travel some distance. What should be the increase in the speed if the same distance is to be covered in 7\[\frac{1}{2}\] hours?
subQuestion.ans: The speed of the car is inversely proportional to the time taken by the car to travel the distance.Let the speed of the car be s and the time taken by the car to travel the distance be t.Here, s varies inversely as t, i.e., `s  α  1/t`.∴ \[s = \frac{k}{t}\] , where k is constant of variation⇒ s × t = kWhen s = 60, t = 8.∴ k = 60 × 8 = 480So, the equation of variation is st = 480.When t = \[7\frac{1}{2}\] h = \[\frac{15}{2}\] h,\[s \times \frac{15}{2} = 480\]⇒ \[s = \frac{480 \times 2}{15}\] = 64 km/h∴ Increase in the speed = 64 − 60 = 4 km/hThus, the increase in the speed of the car is 4 km/h.

subQuestion.ans: Here, selling price = ₹ 900, discount = 20%Let the marked price be ₹ 100Since, the discount given = 20%∴ Amount of discount = ₹ 20∴ Selling price = 100 – 20 = ₹ 80Let actual marked price be ₹ x∴ For marked price of Rs x, selling price is Rs 900\[\therefore \frac{900}{x} = \frac{80}{100}\]∴ 900 × 100 = 80 × x\[\Rightarrow x = \frac{100}{80} \times 900\]= `90000/80`= ₹ 1,125Thus, the marked price is ₹ 1,125.

subQuestion.ans: 12% discount is given on the marked price.Therefore, if marked price is ₹ 100, then selling price is ₹ 88.Let the selling price be ₹ x when the marked price is ₹ 3,000.∴ `x/3000 = 88/100`∴ x = `88/100xx 3000`= ₹ 2,640So, the selling price of the fan is ₹ 2,640.∴ Discount = Marked price − Selling price= ₹ 3,000 − ₹ 2,640= ₹ 360Thus, the discount on fan is ₹ 360.

questions.questionsTitle: A shopkeeper decides to sell a certain item at a certain price. He tags the price on the item by increasing the decided price by 25%. While selling the item, he offers 20% discount. Find how many more or less percent he gets on the decided price.

subQuestion.question: A shopkeeper decides to sell a certain item at a certain price. He tags the price on the item by increasing the decided price by 25%. While selling the item, he offers 20% discount. Find how many more or less percent he gets on the decided price.
subQuestion.ans: Let the decided price of the item be ₹ 100.∴ Marked price of the item = ₹ 100 + 25% of ₹ 100= ₹ 100 + ₹ 25= ₹ 125Discount on the item = 20% of ₹ 125= \[\frac{20}{100} \times 125\]= ₹ 25∴ Selling price of the item = Marked price of the item − Discount on the item= ₹ 125 − ₹ 25= ₹ 100Since the decided price of the item is same as the selling price of the item so the shopkeeper neither makes any profit nor any loss on selling the item.Thus, the shopkeeper gets 0% on the decided price.

subQuestion.question: Radius of a circle with centre O is 25 cm. Find the distance of a chord from the centre if length of the chord is 48 cm.
subQuestion.ans: seg OP ⊥ chord CD            …[Given]∴ l(PD) = `1/2 l(CD)`           …[Perpendicular drawn from the centre of a circle to its chord bisects the chord]∴ l(PD) = `1/2 xx 48`           …[∵ l(CD) = 48 cm]∴ l(PD) = 24 cmIn ΔOPD,∠ OPD = 90°∴ [l(OD)]2= [l(OP)]2+ [l(PD)]2… [Pythagoras theorem]∴ (25)2= [l(OP)]2+ (24)2∴ (25)2− (24)2= [l(OP)]2∴ 625 − 576= [l(OP)]2∴ 49= [l(OP)]2∴ l(OP) = `sqrt(49)`           …[Taking square root of both sides]∴ l(OP) = 7 cm∴ The distance of the chord from the centre of the circle is 7 cm.

questions.questionsTitle: O is centre of the circle. Find the length of radius, if the chord of length 24 cm is at a distance of 9 cm from the centre of the circle.

subQuestion.question: O is centre of the circle. Find the length of radius, if the chord of length 24 cm is at a distance of 9 cm from the centre of the circle.
subQuestion.ans: Join OA.Let the perpendicular drawn from point O to the chord AB be P.We know that the perpendicular drawn from the centre of the circle to the chord bisects the chord.So, AP = `"AB"/2 = 24/2` = 12 cmIn Δ OPA,We apply the Pythagoras theorem,OP2+ AP2= OA2⇒ 92+ 122= OA2⇒ OA2= 81 + 144 = 225⇒ OA = `sqrt225` 15 cmHence, the radius of the circle is 15 cm.

subQuestion.ans: 132 cmExplanationArea = πr2Substituting the given area and π = 3.141386 = 3.14 × r2`r^2 = 1386/3.14`r2= 441Take the square root of both sides to find r:r = `sqrt441`r = 21 cmCircumference = 2πr= 2 × 3.14 × 21= 132 cm

questions.questionsTitle: The side of a cube is 4 m. If it is doubled, how many times will be the volume of the new cube, as compared with the original cube?

subQuestion.question: The side of a cube is 4 m. If it is doubled, how many times will be the volume of the new cube, as compared with the original cube?
subQuestion.ans: Eight timesExplanation:The volume of a cube is given by:Volume = side3Original Cube:The side of the original cube = 4m.Volume of original cube = 43= 64 m3New Cube:If the side is doubled, the new side = 2 × 4 = 8Volume of new cube = 83521 m3Ratio of volumes = `"Volume of new cube"/"Volume of original cube"`= `512/64`= 8

subQuestion.question: In `square` ABCD side AB || side DC, seg AE ⊥ seg DC. If l(AB) = 9 cm, l(AE) = 10 cm, A(`square` ABCD) = 115 cm2, find l(DC).
subQuestion.ans: Given, side AB || side DC.l(AB) = 9 cm, l(AE) = 10 cm,A(ABCD) = 115 cm2∴ ABCD is a trapezium.Area of a trapezium= `(1/2) xx "sum of lengths of parallel sides" xx "height"`∴ A(ABCD) = `(1/2) xx (l("AB") + l("DC") xx l("AE"))`∴ `115 = (1/2) xx (9 + l("DC")) xx 10`∴ `(115 xx 2)/10 = 9 + l("DC")`∴ 23 = 9 + l(DC)∴ l(DC) = 23 – 9∴ l(DC) = 14 cm

subQuestion.ans: Given:For cylindrical tank: diameter (d) = 1.75 m, height (h) = 3.2 mTo Find: Capacity of tank in litrediameter (d) = 1.75 m = 1.75 × 100   ...[∵ 1 m = 100cm]= 175 cm∴ radius (r) = `"d"/2 = 175/2` cmh = 3.2 cm= 3.2 × 100= 320 cmCapacity of tank = Volume of the cylindrical tank = πr2h= `22/7 xx (175/2)^2 xx 320`= `22/7 xx 175/2 xx 175/2 xx 320`= 11 × 25 × 175 × 160= 77,00,000 cc= `7700000/1000` litre   ...[1 litre = 1000 cc]= 7700 litres∴ The capacity of the tank is 7700 litres.

questions.questionsTitle: In a library, 50% of the total number of books is of Marathi. The books of English are `1/3`rd of Marathi books. The books on mathematics are 25% of the English books. The remaining 560 books are of other subjects. What is the total number of books in the library?

subQuestion.question: In a library, 50% of the total number of books is of Marathi. The books of English are `1/3`rd of Marathi books. The books on mathematics are 25% of the English books. The remaining 560 books are of other subjects. What is the total number of books in the library?
subQuestion.ans: Let the total number of books in the library be x50% of total number of books is of Marathi.Number of Marathi books = 50% of x= `(50/100)x`= `x/2`The books of English are `(1/3)` of Marathi books.Number of books of English = `(1/3) xx (x/2)`= `x/6`The books on Mathematics are 25% of the English books.Number of books of Mathematics= 25% of `x/6`= `(25/100) xx (x/6)`= `x/24`Since there are 560 books of other subjects, the total number of books in the library are`x = x/2 + x/6 + x/24 + 560`∴ `x = (x xx 12)/(2 xx 12) + (x xx 4)/(6 xx 4) + x/24 + 560`∴ ` x = (12x)/24 + (4x)/24 + x/24 + 560`∴ `x = (12x + 4x + x)/24 + 560`∴ `x = (17x)/24 + 560`∴ `x xx 24 = (17x)/24 xx 24 + 560 xx 24`∴ 24x = 17x + 13440∴ 24x − 17x = 13440∴ 7x = 13440∴ x = `13440/7`∴ x = 1920∴ The total number of books in the library are 1920.

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure, if line m || line n and line p are a transversal then find x.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure, if line m || line n and line p are a transversal then find x.
subQuestion.ans: 45°Explanation:Let us mark P and Q on m, R, and S on n, A, and B on p.Suppose PQ and AB intersect at M; RS and AB intersect at N.Since, m||n and p are transversals, thenm∠QMN + m∠SNM = 180°    (Interior angles on the same side of transversal are supplementary)Substituting the values in the above equation, we get3x + x = 180°⇒ 4x = 180°⇒ x = `(180°)/4`∴ x = 45°

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure, if line a || line b and line l is a transversal then find x.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure, if line a || line b and line l is a transversal then find x.
subQuestion.ans: 30°Explanation:Let us mark the points P and Q on a; R and S on b; A and B on l.Suppose PQ and AB intersect at M; RS and AB intersect at N.Since a||b and l is a transversal, thenm∠ RNM = m∠ SNB    (Vertically opposite angles)⇒ ∠ RNM  = 2xNow, m∠ RNM + m∠ PMN  = 180°    (Interior angles on the same side of the transversal are supplementary)⇒ 2x + 4x = 180°⇒ 6x = 180°⇒ x = `(180°)/6`⇒ x = 30°

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure line p || line q. Line t and line s are transversals. Find measure of ∠x and ∠y using the measures of angles given in the figure.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure line p || line q. Line t and line s are transversals. Find measure of ∠x and ∠y using the measures of angles given in the figure.
subQuestion.ans: Let us mark the points P and Q on p; R and S on q; A and B on t; C and D on s.Suppose PQ and AB intersect at K; PQ and CD intersect at X.Suppose RS and AB intersect at L; RS and CD intersect at Y.Since AB is a straight line and ray KQ stands on it,m∠ AKX + m∠ XKL = 180°    (angles in linear pair)⇒ 40° + m∠ XKL = 180°⇒ m∠ XKL = 180° − 40°⇒ m∠ XKL = 140°Since p || q and t is a transversal, thenm∠ YLB = m∠ XKL    (Corresponding angles)⇒ x = 140°Since RS and CD are two straight lines intersecting at Y, thenm∠ XYL = m∠ SYD    (Vertically opposite angles)⇒ m∠ XYL = 70°Since, p || q and s is a transversal, thenm∠ KXY + m∠ XYL = 180°    (Interior angles on same side of transversal are supplementary)⇒ y + 70° = 180°⇒ y = 180° −  70°⇒ y = 110°

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure. line p || line q. line l || line m. Find measures of ∠a, ∠b, and ∠c, using the measures of given angles. Justify your answers.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure. line p || line q. line l || line m. Find measures of ∠a, ∠b, and ∠c, using the measures of given angles. Justify your answers.
subQuestion.ans: Let us mark the points A and B on p; X and Y on q; P and Q on l; R and S on m.Suppose AB and XY intersect PQ at K and L respectively.Suppose AB and XY intersect RS at N and M respectively.Since p || q and l is a transversal, thenm∠ AKL + m∠ XLK = 180°    (Interior angles on same side of transversal are supplementary)⇒ 80° + m∠ XLK = 180°⇒ m∠ XLK = 180° − 80°⇒ m∠ XLK = 100°Since PQ and XY are straight lines that intersect at L, thenm∠ QLM = m∠ XLK    (Vertically opposite angles)⇒ a = 100°Since l || m and p is a transversal, thenm∠ BNR = m∠ AKL    (Alternate exterior angles)⇒ c = 80°Since p || q and m is a transversal, thenm∠ NMY= m∠ RNB    (Corresponding angles)⇒ b = c⇒ b = 80°

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure, line a || line b. line l is a transversal. Find the measures of ∠x, ∠y, ∠z using the given information.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure, line a || line b. line l is a transversal. Find the measures of ∠x, ∠y, ∠z using the given information.
subQuestion.ans: Let us mark the points A and B on l; K and M on a; L and N on b.Suppose KM and LN intersect AB at P and Q respectively.Since, a || b and l is a transversal, thenm∠ PQL = m∠ APK    (Corresponding angles)⇒ x = 105°Since AB and LN are straight lines that intersect at Q, thenm∠ BQN = m∠ PQL    (Vertically opposite angles)⇒ y = x⇒ y = 105°Since AB is a straight line and ray QN stands on it, thenm∠ BQN + m∠ PQN = 180°    (Angles in linear pair)⇒ y + m∠ PQN = 180°⇒ 105° + m∠ PQN = 180°⇒ m∠ PQN = 180° − 105°⇒ m∠ PQN = 75°Now, m∠ APM = m∠ PQN    (Corresponding angles)⇒ z = 75°

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure, line p || line l || line q.  Find ∠x with the help of the measures given in the figure.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure, line p || line l || line q.  Find ∠x with the help of the measures given in the figure.
subQuestion.ans: Let us mark the points A, L and B on p; C, M and D on l; P, N and Q on q.Since, AB || CD and LM is a transversal intersecting AB at L and CD at M, thenm∠ LMD = ​m∠ ALM    (Alternate interior angles)⇒ m∠ LMD = 40°Since, CD || PQ and MN is a transversal intersecting CD at M and PQ at N, thenm∠ DMN = ​m∠ PNM    (Alternate interior angles)⇒ m∠ DMN = 30°Now, m∠ LMD + m∠ DMN = 40° + 30°⇒ m∠ LMN = 70°⇒ x = 70°

subQuestion.ans: If l(RG) = 2.5 then l(GC) =5.Explanation:In ∆ABC, the medians AP, BQ, and CR to the sides BC, CA, and AB respectively intersect at G.

subQuestion.question: If l(RG) = 2.5 then l(GC) = ______.
subQuestion.ans: Since then the centroid of a triangle divides the medians in the ratio of 2 : 1, then AG : GP = BG :GQ = CG : GR = 2 : 1We have, CG: GR = 2 : 1⇒ `("GC")/("RG") = 2/1`⇒ `("GC")/(2.5) = 2/1`⇒ GC = 5

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{m^2 - n^2}{\left( m + n \right)^2} \times \frac{m^2 + mn + n^2}{m^3 - n^3}\]
subQuestion.ans: We know that,a3+ b3= (a + b)(a2− ab + b2)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)\[\frac{m^2 - n^2}{\left( m + n \right)^2} \times \frac{m^2 + mn + n^2}{m^3 - n^3}\]\[ = \frac{\left( m + n \right)\left( m - n \right)}{\left( m + n \right)\left( m + n \right)} \times \frac{\left( m^2 + mn + n^2 \right)}{\left( m - n \right)\left( m^2 + mn + n^2 \right)}\]\[= \frac{1}{m + n}\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{a^2 + 10a + 21}{a^2 + 6a - 7} \times \frac{a^2 - 1}{a + 3}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)\[\ \frac{a^2 + 10a + 21}{a^2 + 6a - 7} \times \frac{a^2 - 1}{a + 3}\]\[= \frac{a^2 + 7a + 3a + 21}{a^2 + 7a - a - 7} \times   \frac{\left(a + 1 \right)\left(a - 1 \right)}{\left(a + 3 \right)}\]\[= \frac{a\left(a + 7 \right) + 3\left(a + 7 \right)}{a \left(a + 7 \right) - 1\left(a + 7 \right)} \times \frac{\left(a + 1 \right)\left(a - 1 \right)}{\left(a + 3 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{\left(a + 7 \right)\left(a + 3 \right)}{\left(a - 1 \right)\left(a + 7 \right)} \times \frac{\left(a + 1 \right)\left(a - 1 \right)}{\left(a + 3 \right)}\]= (a + 1)

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{8 x^3 - 27 y^3}{4 x^2 - 9 y^2}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)\[\  \frac{8 x^3 - 27 y^3}{4 x^2 - 9 y^2}\]\[ = \frac{\left( 2x \right)^3 - \left( 3y \right)^3}{\left( 2x \right)^2 - \left( 3y \right)^2}\]\[ = \frac{\left( 2x - 3y \right)\left[ \left( 2x \right)^2 + \left( 2x \right) \times \left( 3y \right) + \left( 3y \right)^2 \right]}{\left( 2x + 3y \right)\left( 2x - 3y \right)}\]\[= \frac{\left(2x - 3y \right)\left(4 x^2 + 6xy + 9 y^2 \right)}{\left( 2x + 3y \right)\left(2x - 3y \right)}\]\[= \frac{4 x^2 + 6xy + 9 y^2}{\left(2x + 3y \right)}\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{x^2 - 5x - 24}{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x + 8 \right)} \times \frac{x^2 - 64}{\left( x - 8 \right)^2}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)\[\  \frac{x^2 - 5x - 24}{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x + 8 \right)} \times \frac{x^2 - 64}{\left( x - 8 \right)^2}\]\[ = \frac{x^2 - 8x + 3x - 24}{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x + 8 \right)} \times \frac{\left( x \right)^2 - \left( 8 \right)^2}{\left( x - 8 \right)^2}\]\[ = \frac{x\left( x - 8 \right) + 3\left( x - 8 \right)}{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x + 8 \right)} \times \frac{\left( x + 8 \right)\left( x - 8 \right)}{\left( x - 8 \right)\left( x - 8 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x - 8 \right)}{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x + 8 \right)} \times \frac{\left( x + 8 \right)\left( x - 8 \right)}{\left( x - 8 \right)\left( x - 8 \right)}\]= 1

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:
Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{4 x^2 - 11x + 6}{16 x^2 - 9}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)\[\ \frac{4 x^2 - 11x + 6}{16 x^2 - 9}\]\[ = \frac{4 x^2 - 8x - 3x + 6}{\left(4x \right)^2 - \left(3 \right)^2}\]\[ = \frac{4x\left(x - 2 \right) - 3\left(x - 2 \right)}{\left(4x + 3 \right)\left(4x - 3 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{\left(4x - 3 \right)\left(x - 2 \right)}{\left(4x + 3 \right)\left( 4x - 3 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{x - 2}{4x + 3}\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{a^3 - 27}{5 a^2 - 16a + 3} \div \frac{a^2 + 3a + 9}{25 a^2 - 1}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)\[\  \frac{a^3 - 27}{5 a^2 - 16a + 3} \div \frac{a^2 + 3a + 9}{25 a^2 - 1}\]\[ = \frac{\left( a \right)^3 - \left(3 \right)^3}{5 a^2 - 15a - a + 3}   \div \frac{a^2 + 3a + 9}{\left( 5a \right)^2 - \left( 1 \right)^2}\]\[ = \frac{\left(a - 3 \right)\left\{ \left( a \right)^2 + \left(a \right) \times \left(3 \right) + \left(3 \right)^2 \right\}}{5a\left(a - 3 \right) - 1\left( a - 3 \right)} \div \frac{a^2 + 3a + 9}{\left(5a + 1 \right)\left(5a - 1 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{\left(a - 3 \right)\left(a^2 + 3a + 9 \right)}{\left(5a - 1 \right)\left(a - 3 \right)} \div \frac{\left( a^2 + 3a + 9 \right)}{\left(5a + 1 \right)\left(5a - 1 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{\left(a - 3 \right)\left(a^2 + 3a + 9 \right)}{\left(5a - 1 \right)\left(a - 3 \right)} \times \frac{\left(5a + 1 \right)\left(5a - 1 \right)}{\left(a^2 + 3a + 9 \right)}\]\[ = 5a + 1\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{1 - 2x + x^2}{1 - x^3} \times \frac{1 + x + x^2}{1 + x}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)\[\  \frac{1 - 2x + x^2}{1 - x^3} \times \frac{1 + x + x^2}{1 + x}\]\[ = \frac{1 - x - x + x^2}{\left(1 \right)^3 - \left(x \right)^3} \times \frac{1 + x + x^2}{1 + x}\]\[ = \frac{1\left(1 - x \right) - x\left(1 - x \right)}{\left(1 - x \right)\left\{ \left(1 \right)^2 + \left(1 \right) \times \left( x \right) + \left(x \right)^2 \right\}}   \times   \frac{\left(1 + x + x^2 \right)}{1 + x}\]\[ = \frac{\left(1 - x \right)\left( 1 - x \right)}{\left(1 - x \right)\left(1 + x + x^2 \right)} \times \frac{\left(1 + x + x^2 \right)}{\left(1 + x \right)}\]\[ = \frac{1 - x}{1 + x}\]

questions.questionsTitle: If diagonal of a rectangle is 26 cm and one side is 24 cm, find the other side.

subQuestion.question: If diagonal of a rectangle is 26 cm and one side is 24 cm, find the other side.
subQuestion.ans: Suppose ABCD is a rectangle.Here, segment AC is a diagonal and segment AD is one side of the rectangle ABCD.l(AC) = 26 cm and l(AD) = 24 cm.In right ∆ACD,l(AC)2= l(AD)2+ l(CD)2...(Pythagoras theorem)⇒ l(CD)2= l(AC)2− l(AD)2⇒ l(CD)2= (26)2− (24)2⇒ l(CD)2= 676 − 576 = 100⇒ l(CD)=  `sqrt(100)` = 10 cmThus, the other side of the rectangle is 10 cm.

questions.questionsTitle: Lengths of diagonals of a rhombus ABCD are 16 cm and 12 cm. Find the side and perimeter of the rhombus.

subQuestion.question: Lengths of diagonals of a rhombus ABCD are 16 cm and 12 cm. Find the side and perimeter of the rhombus.
subQuestion.ans: ABCD is a rhombus.Here, segment AC and segment BD are the diagonals of the rhombus ABCD.l(AC) = 16 cm and l(BD) = 12 cm.Diagonals of a rhombus are perpendicular bisectors of each other.∴ m∠AOD = 90°Also, l(OA) = `1/2l(AC) = 1/2 xx 16 = 8  cm`l(OD) = `1/2l(BD) = 1/2`× 12 = 6 cmIn right ∆AOD,l(AD)2= l(OA)2+ l(OD)2...[Pythagoras theorem]⇒ l(AD)2= (8)2+ (6)2⇒ l(AD)2= 64 + 36 = 100⇒ l(AD)= \[\sqrt{100}\] = 10 cmAll sides of a rhombus are equal.∴ Perimeter of the rhombus ABCD = 4 × Side of a rhombus = 4 × 10 = 40 cmThus, the side and perimeter of the rhombus are 10 cm and 40 cm, respectively.

questions.questionsTitle: Find the length of diagonal of a square with side 8 cm.

subQuestion.question: Find the length of diagonal of a square with side 8 cm.
subQuestion.ans: Suppose ABCD is a square of side 8 cm.Here, segment AC is a diagonal of square ABCD.In ∆ABC,l(AC)2= l(AB)2+ l(BC)2...(Pythagoras theorem)⇒ l(AC)2= (8)2+ (8)2⇒ l(AC)2= 64 + 64 = 128⇒ l(AC)= \[\sqrt{128}\] cm        …[Taking square root of both sides]⇒ l(AC)= \[\sqrt{64 × 2}\] cm⇒ l(AC)= 8\[\sqrt{2}\] cmThus, the length of diagonal of square is 8\[\sqrt{2}\] cm.

questions.questionsTitle: Measure of one angle of a rhombus is 50°, find the measures of remaining three angles.

subQuestion.question: Measure of one angle of a rhombus is 50°, find the measures of remaining three angles.
subQuestion.ans: Suppose ABCD is a rhombus.Let m∠A = 50ºOpposite angles of a rhombus are congruentes.∴ m∠C = m∠A = 50º and m∠B = m∠DNow,m∠A + m∠B + m∠C + m∠D = 360º∴ 50º + m∠B + 50º + m∠D = 360º⇒ m∠B + m∠D = 360º − 100º = 260º⇒ 2 m∠B = 260º   ...(m∠B = m∠D)⇒ m∠B = `(260°)/2` = 130°∴ m∠D = m∠B = 130ºThus, the measures of the remaining angles of the rhombus are 130º, 50º, and 130º.

questions.questionsTitle: Measures of opposite angles of a parallelogram are (3x − 2)° and (50 − x)°. Find the measure of its each angle.

subQuestion.question: Measures of opposite angles of a parallelogram are (3x − 2)° and (50 − x)°. Find the measure of its each angle.
subQuestion.ans: Let ABCD be the parallelogram.Suppose ∠A = (3x − 2)º and ∠C = (50 − x)º.We know that the opposite angles of a paralelogram are congruentes.∴ m∠A = m∠C⇒ 3x − 2 = 50 − x⇒ 3x + x = 50 + 2⇒ 4x = 52⇒ x = `52/4`⇒ x = 13∴ m∠A = (3x − 2)º = (3 × 13 − 2)º = (39 − 2)​º = 37ºSo, m∠C = m∠A = 37ºAlso, the adjacent angles of a parallelogram are supplementary.∴ m∠A + m∠D = 180º⇒ 37º + m∠D = 180º⇒ m∠D = 180º − 37º = 143ºNow,m∠B = m∠D = 143º               (Opposite angles of a parallelogram are congruent)Thus, the measure of the angles of the parallelogram are 37º, 143º, 37º and 143º.

questions.questionsTitle: Ratio of consecutive angles of a quadrilateral is 1 : 2 : 3 : 4. Find the measure of its each angle. Write, with reason, what type of a quadrilateral it is.

subQuestion.question: Ratio of consecutive angles of a quadrilateral is 1 : 2 : 3 : 4. Find the measure of its each angle. Write, with reason, what type of a quadrilateral it is.
subQuestion.ans: Suppose PQRS is a quadrilateral.Let m∠P : m∠Q : m∠R : m∠S = 1 : 2 : 3 : 4So, m∠P = k, m∠Q = 2k, m∠R = 3k and m∠S = 4k, where k is some constantNow,m∠P + m∠Q  + m∠R + m∠S = 360°∴ k + 2k + 3k + 4k = 360°⇒ 10k = 360°⇒ k = 36°∴ m∠P = 36°m∠Q = 2k = 2 × 36° = 72°m∠R = 3k = 3 × 36° = 108°m∠S = 4k = 4 × 36° = 144°Now,  m∠P + m∠S = 36° + 144° = 180°We know if two lines are intersected by a transversal such that the sum of interior angles on the same transversal is supplementary, then the two lines are parallel.∴ Side PQ || Side SRAlso, m∠P + m∠Q = 36° + 72° = 108° ≠ 180°So, side PS is not parallel to side QR.In quadrilateral PQRS, only one pair of opposite sides is parallel.

subQuestion.ans: 3x + 12 = 2x − 4Subtracting 12 from both sides⇒ 3x + 12 − 12 = 2x − 4 − 12⇒ 3x = 2x − 16Subtracting 2x from both sides⇒ 3x − 2x = 2x − 16 − 2x⇒ x = −16Hence, x = −16 is the solution of the equation.

subQuestion.question: 5(x − 3) = 3(x + 2)
subQuestion.ans: 5(x − 3) = 3(x + 2)⇒ 5x − 15 = 3x + 6Adding 15 to both sides⇒ 5x − 15 + 15 = 3x + 6 + 15⇒ 5x = 3x + 21Subtracting 3x from both sides⇒ 5x − 3x = 3x + 21 − 3x⇒ 2x = 21Dividing both sides by 2⇒ `(2"x")/2 = 21/2`⇒ x = `21/2`Hence, x = `21/2` is the solution of the equation.

questions.questionsTitle: Solve the following equation.

questions.questionsTitle: Solve the following equation.

subQuestion.question: `("b" + ("b" + 1) + ("b" + 2))/4 = 21`
subQuestion.ans: `("b" + ("b" + 1) + ("b" + 2))/4 = 21`Multiplying both sides by 4⇒ 4 x `("b" + ("b" + 1) + ("b" + 2))/4 = 4 xx 21`⇒ b + (b + 1) + (b + 2) = 84⇒ 3b + 3 = 84Subtracting 3 from both sides⇒ 3b + 3 - 3 = 84 - 3⇒ 3b = 81Dividing both sides by 3⇒ `(3"b")/3 = 81/3`⇒ b = 27Hence, b = 27 is the solution of the equation.

questions.questionsTitle: Mother is 25 year older than her son. Find son's age if after 8 years ratio of son's age to mother's age will be `4/9`.

subQuestion.question: Mother is 25 year older than her son. Find son's age if after 8 years ratio of son's age to mother's age will be `4/9`.
subQuestion.ans: Let the present age of the son be x years.Age of the mother = (x + 25) yearsAfter 8 years,Age of son = (x + 8) yearsAge of mother = (x + 25 + 8) years= (x + 33) yearsFrom the given information,`("x" + 8)/("x" + 33) = 4/9`⇒ 9(x + 8) = 4(x + 33)⇒ 9x + 72 = 4x + 132⇒ 9x - 4x = 132 - 72⇒ 5x = 60⇒ `"x" = 60/5`⇒ x = 12Hence, the present age of the son is 12 years.

questions.questionsTitle: The denominator of a fraction is greater than its numerator by 12. If the numerator is decreased by 2 and the denominator is increased by 7, the new fraction is equivalent with `1/2`. Find the fraction.

subQuestion.question: The denominator of a fraction is greater than its numerator by 12. If the numerator is decreased by 2 and the denominator is increased by 7, the new fraction is equivalent with `1/2`. Find the fraction.
subQuestion.ans: Let the numerator of the fraction be x.∴ Denominator = x + 12∴ The fraction = `"x"/("x" + 12)`If the numerator is decreased by 2 and the denominator is increased by 7, the new fraction obtained is `1/2`.From the given information,`("x" - 2)/("x" + 12 + 7) = 1/2`⇒ 2 (x − 2) = 1 ( x + 12 + 7)⇒  2x − 4 = x + 19⇒  2x − x = 19 + 4⇒  x = 23∴ Numerator of the fraction is 23.∴ Denominator of the fraction is 23 + 12 = 35.Hence, the fraction is `23/35`.

questions.questionsTitle: The ratio of weight of copper and zinc in brass is 13 : 7. find the weight of zinc in a brass utensil weighing 700 gm.

subQuestion.question: The ratio of weight of copper and zinc in brass is 13 : 7. find the weight of zinc in a brass utensil weighing 700 gm.
subQuestion.ans: Let the weight of zinc in the brass utensil be x gm.Since the ratio of the weights of copper to zinc in brass is 13:7.∴ `"Weights of copper"/"Weight of zinc" = 13/7`∴ `"Weights of copper"/x = 13/7`∴ Weight of copper in the brass utensil = `(13/7x)` gmThe weight of the brass utensil = 700 gm∴ `13/7x + x = 700`∴ `(13/7x) x xx 7 + x xx 7= 700 xx 7`∴ 13x + 7x = 4900∴ 20x = 4900∴ x = `4900/20`∴ x = 245∴ The weight of zinc in the brass utensil is 245 gm.

questions.questionsTitle: Find three conescutive whole numbers whose sum is more than 45 but less than 54.

subQuestion.question: Find three conescutive whole numbers whose sum is more than 45 but less than 54.
subQuestion.ans: Let the three consecutive whole numbers be (x – 1), x and (x + 1).∴ Sum of the three numbers= (x – 1) + x + (x + 1)= 3xGiven that, the sum of the three numbers is greater than 45 and less than 54.When the sum of the three numbers is 45,∴ 3x = 45∴ x = `45/3`∴ x = 15When the sum of the three numbers is 54,∴ 3x = 54∴ x = `54/3`∴ x = 18∴ the value of x is greater than 15 and less than 18.∴ the value of x is either 16 or 17.Case I:If the value of x is 16, then the three consecutive whole numbers are(16 – 1), 16, (16 + 1)i.e., 15, 16, 17Case II:If the value of x is 17, then the three consecutive whole numbers are (17 – 1), 17, and (17 + 1)i.e., 16, 17, 18.∴ The three consecutive whole numbers are 15, 16, 17 or 16, 17, 18.

questions.questionsTitle: In a two digit number, digit at the ten's place is twice the digit at units's place. If the number obtained by interchanging the digits is added to the original number, the sum is 66. find the number.

subQuestion.question: In a two digit number, digit at the ten's place is twice the digit at units's place. If the number obtained by interchanging the digits is added to the original number, the sum is 66. find the number.
subQuestion.ans: Let the digit at the unit's place be x.Digit at tens place = 2xOriginal number = (2x)×10 + x = 21xNumber obtained by interchanging the digits = (x) × 10 + 2x = 12xFrom the given information,12x + 21x = 6633x = 66x = 2∴ The unit's digit = 2.∴ Original number = 21 × 2 = 42.Hence, the original  number is 42.

questions.questionsTitle: Some tickets of ₹ 200 and some of ₹ 100, of a drama in a theatre were sold. The number of tickets of ₹ 200 sold was 20 more than the number of tickets of ₹ 100. The total amount received by the theatre by sale of tickets was ₹ 37000. Find the number of ₹ 100 tickets sold.

subQuestion.question: Some tickets of ₹ 200 and some of ₹ 100, of a drama in a theatre were sold. The number of tickets of ₹ 200 sold was 20 more than the number of tickets of ₹ 100. The total amount received by the theatre by sale of tickets was ₹ 37000. Find the number of ₹ 100 tickets sold.
subQuestion.ans: Let the number of tickets of ₹ 100 be x.Number of tickets of ₹ 200 = x + 20From the given information,100(x) + 200 (x + 20) = 37000⇒ 100x + 200x + 4000 = 37000⇒ 300x = 37000 - 4000⇒ 300x = 33000⇒ x = 110∴ The number of tickets of ₹ 100 = 110.Number of tickets of ₹ 200 = 110 + 20 = 130.Hence, the number of tickets of ₹ 100 is 110.

questions.questionsTitle: Of the three consecutive natural numbers, five times the smallest number is 9 more than four times the greatest number. Find the numbers.

subQuestion.question: Of the three consecutive natural numbers, five times the smallest number is 9 more than four times the greatest number. Find the numbers.
subQuestion.ans: Let the three consecutive natural numbers be x, x + 1, x + 2.From the given information,5(x) = 4 (x + 2) + 9⇒ 5x = 4x + 8 + 9⇒ 5x − 4x = 17⇒ x = 17∴ The three consecutive natural numbers are 17, 17 + 1, and 17 + 2.Hence, the three consecutive natural numbers are 17, 18, and 19.

questions.questionsTitle: Raju sold a bicycle to Amit at 8% profit. Amit repaired it spending ₹ 54. Then he sold the bicycle to Nikhil for ₹ 1134 with no loss and no profit. Find the cost price of the bicycle for which Raju purchased it.

subQuestion.question: Raju sold a bicycle to Amit at 8% profit. Amit repaired it spending ₹ 54. Then he sold the bicycle to Nikhil for ₹ 1134 with no loss and no profit. Find the cost price of the bicycle for which Raju purchased it.
subQuestion.ans: Let the cost price of the bicycle for Raju = ₹ xThe selling price of bicycle for Raju = Cost price of bicycle  + Profit= x + 8% on cost price= `x + 8/100 xxx`= `x + 8/100x`∴ The selling price of the bicycle for Raju = Purchase price of bicycle for amit∴ Purchase price of bicycle for Amit = `x + 8/100x ` ...(i)Now selling price of bicycle for Amit = purchase price of bicycle for amit + Reparing= `x + 8/100x + 54`   from (i) and given∴ Selling price of bicycle for Amit = purchase price of bicycle for Nikhil∴ Purchase price of bicycle for Nikhil = `x + 8/100x + 54`∴` 1134 = x + 8/100x + 54`    ...given∴ `x + 8/100x = 1134 - 54`∴ `(100x + 8x)/100` = 1080∴ 108x = 1080 × 100= `x = (1080 xx 100)/108`∴ x = ₹ 1000∴ The cost price of bicycle for which Raju purchased = ₹ 1000

questions.questionsTitle: Sudhir's present age is 5 more than three times the age of Viru. Anil's age is half the age of Sudhir. If the ratio of the sum of Sudhir's and Viru's age to three times Anil's age is 5:6, then find Viru's age.

subQuestion.question: Sudhir's present age is 5 more than three times the age of Viru. Anil's age is half the age of Sudhir. If the ratio of the sum of Sudhir's and Viru's age to three times Anil's age is 5:6, then find Viru's age.
subQuestion.ans: Let Viru's present age be x years.Sudhir's present age = (5 + 3x) yearsAnil's present age = `((5 + 3"x")/2)` years∴ From the given information,`(5 + 3"x") + ("x") : 3(5 + 3"x")/2 = 5 : 6`⇒ `(5 + 4x)/(3(5 + 3"x")/2` = `5/6`⇒ `(2(5 + 4"x"))/(15 + 9x) = 5/6`⇒ `(10 + 8"x")/(15 + 9"x") = 5/6`⇒ 6 (10 + 8x) = 5 (15 + 9x)⇒ 60 + 48x = 75 + 45x⇒ 48x − 45x = 75 − 60⇒ 3x = 15⇒ x = 5Hence, Viru's age is 5 years.

questions.questionsTitle: On the construction work of a flyover bridge there were 320 workers initially. The number of workers were increased by 25% every year. Find the number of workers after 2 years.

subQuestion.question: On the construction work of a flyover bridge there were 320 workers initially. The number of workers were increased by 25% every year. Find the number of workers after 2 years.
subQuestion.ans: Here, P = Number of workers initially = 320A = Number of workers after 2 yearsR = Rate of increase of number of workers per year = 25 %N = 2 yearsA =  `"P"(1 + "R"/100)^"N"`= `320(1 + 25/100)^2`= `320((100+25)/100)^2`= `320(125/100)^2`= `320 xx 125/100 xx 125/100`= `5000000/10000`A = 500Hence, the number of workers after 2 years is 500.

questions.questionsTitle: A shepherd has 200 sheep with him. Find the number of sheep with him after 3 years if the increase in the number of sheep is 8% every year.

subQuestion.question: A shepherd has 200 sheep with him. Find the number of sheep with him after 3 years if the increase in the number of sheep is 8% every year.
subQuestion.ans: Here, P = Number of sheep initially = 200A = Number of sheep after 3 yearsR = Rate of increase in the number of sheep per year = 8%N = 3 yearsA = P `(1 + "R"/100)^"N"`= 200 `(1 + 8/100)^3`= `200((100 + 8)/100)^3`= `200(108/100)^3`= `200((27 xx 4)/(25 xx 4))^3`= `200(27/25)^3`= `200 xx 27/25 xx 27/25 xx 27/25`= `8 xx 27 xx 27/25 xx 27/25`= `0.32/25 xx 27 xx 27 xx 27`= `0.0128 xx 27 xx 27 xx 27`= 251.9424= 252∴ The number of sheep with the shepherd after 3 years would be 252 (approx).

subQuestion.question: In a forest there are 40,000 trees. Find the expected number of trees after 3 years if the objective is to increase the number at the rate 5% per year.
subQuestion.ans: Here, P = Number of trees initially = 40,000A = Number of trees after 3 yearsR = Rate of increase of number of trees per year = 5 %N = 3 yearsA = P `(1 + "R"/100)^"N"`= 40000 `(1 + 5/100)^3`= 40000 `(1 + 1/20)^3`= 40000 `(21/20)^3`= 46305Hence, the expected number of trees after 3 years is 46,305.

questions.questionsTitle: The cost price of a machine is 2,50,000. If the rate of depreciation is 10% per year, find the depreciation in price of the machine after two years.

subQuestion.question: The cost price of a machine is 2,50,000. If the rate of depreciation is 10% per year, find the depreciation in price of the machine after two years.
subQuestion.ans: Here, P = Cost price of the machine = 2,50,000A = Cost price after 2 yearsI = Depreciation in price after 2 yearsR = Rate of depreciation = 10 %N = 2 yearsA = P `(1 + "R"/100)^"N"`= 2,50,000 `(1 + (-10)/100)^2`= 2,50,000 `(1 - 1/100)^2`= 2,50,000 `((100 - 10)/100)^2`= 2,50,000 `(90/100)^2`= 2,50,000 `(9/10)^2`= 2,50,000 `(81/100)`= 2,500 × 81= 2,02,500Depreciation in price = Cost price (P) – Depreciated price (A)= 2,50,000 − 2,02,500= 47,500∴ The depreciation in the price of the machine after 2 years would be 47,500.

subQuestion.question: Find the difference between simple interest and compound interest on ₹ 20000 at 8 p.c.p.a.
subQuestion.ans: Here, P = Principal = ₹ 20000R = 8 %N = 2 yearsSimple interest (I):Simple interest = `("P" xx "R" xx "N")/100`= `(20000 xx 8 xx 2)/100`= 3200Compound Interest (I):A = `"P" (1 + "R"/100)^"N"`= `20000(1 + 8/100)^2`= `20000((100 + 8)/100)^2`= `20000(108/100)^2`= `20000 ((27 xx 4)/(25 xx 4))^2`= `20000(27/25)^2`= `20000 xx 27/25 xx 27/25`= 32 × 27 × 27= 23328Compound interest= Amount (A) – Principal (P)= 23328 – 20000= 3328Difference:= Compound interest – Simple interest= 3328 – 3200= 128Hence, the difference between simple interest and compound interest is ₹ 128.

subQuestion.ans: For brick,Length(l) = 25 cmBreadth(b) = 15 cmHeight (h) = 10 cmFor wall,Length(l1) = 6 m = 600 cmBreadth(b1) = 0.5 m = 50 cmHeight (h1) = 2.5 m = 250 cmNumber of bricks required to build the wall = `"Volume of the wall"/"Volume of the bricks"`= `(l_1 xx b_1 xx h_1)/(l xx b xx h)`= `(600 xx 50 xx 250)/(25 xx 15 xx 10)`= `(600 xx 250)/(25 xx 3)`= 200 × 10= 2000The number of brick required to build the wall is 2000 bricks.

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure, if line m || line n and line p are a transversal then find x.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure, if line m || line n and line p are a transversal then find x.
subQuestion.ans: 45°Explanation:Let us mark P and Q on m, R, and S on n, A, and B on p.Suppose PQ and AB intersect at M; RS and AB intersect at N.Since, m||n and p are transversals, thenm∠QMN + m∠SNM = 180°    (Interior angles on the same side of transversal are supplementary)Substituting the values in the above equation, we get3x + x = 180°⇒ 4x = 180°⇒ x = `(180°)/4`∴ x = 45°

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure, if line a || line b and line l is a transversal then find x.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure, if line a || line b and line l is a transversal then find x.
subQuestion.ans: 30°Explanation:Let us mark the points P and Q on a; R and S on b; A and B on l.Suppose PQ and AB intersect at M; RS and AB intersect at N.Since a||b and l is a transversal, thenm∠ RNM = m∠ SNB    (Vertically opposite angles)⇒ ∠ RNM  = 2xNow, m∠ RNM + m∠ PMN  = 180°    (Interior angles on the same side of the transversal are supplementary)⇒ 2x + 4x = 180°⇒ 6x = 180°⇒ x = `(180°)/6`⇒ x = 30°

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure line p || line q. Line t and line s are transversals. Find measure of ∠x and ∠y using the measures of angles given in the figure.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure line p || line q. Line t and line s are transversals. Find measure of ∠x and ∠y using the measures of angles given in the figure.
subQuestion.ans: Let us mark the points P and Q on p; R and S on q; A and B on t; C and D on s.Suppose PQ and AB intersect at K; PQ and CD intersect at X.Suppose RS and AB intersect at L; RS and CD intersect at Y.Since AB is a straight line and ray KQ stands on it,m∠ AKX + m∠ XKL = 180°    (angles in linear pair)⇒ 40° + m∠ XKL = 180°⇒ m∠ XKL = 180° − 40°⇒ m∠ XKL = 140°Since p || q and t is a transversal, thenm∠ YLB = m∠ XKL    (Corresponding angles)⇒ x = 140°Since RS and CD are two straight lines intersecting at Y, thenm∠ XYL = m∠ SYD    (Vertically opposite angles)⇒ m∠ XYL = 70°Since, p || q and s is a transversal, thenm∠ KXY + m∠ XYL = 180°    (Interior angles on same side of transversal are supplementary)⇒ y + 70° = 180°⇒ y = 180° −  70°⇒ y = 110°

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure. line p || line q. line l || line m. Find measures of ∠a, ∠b, and ∠c, using the measures of given angles. Justify your answers.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure. line p || line q. line l || line m. Find measures of ∠a, ∠b, and ∠c, using the measures of given angles. Justify your answers.
subQuestion.ans: Let us mark the points A and B on p; X and Y on q; P and Q on l; R and S on m.Suppose AB and XY intersect PQ at K and L respectively.Suppose AB and XY intersect RS at N and M respectively.Since p || q and l is a transversal, thenm∠ AKL + m∠ XLK = 180°    (Interior angles on same side of transversal are supplementary)⇒ 80° + m∠ XLK = 180°⇒ m∠ XLK = 180° − 80°⇒ m∠ XLK = 100°Since PQ and XY are straight lines that intersect at L, thenm∠ QLM = m∠ XLK    (Vertically opposite angles)⇒ a = 100°Since l || m and p is a transversal, thenm∠ BNR = m∠ AKL    (Alternate exterior angles)⇒ c = 80°Since p || q and m is a transversal, thenm∠ NMY= m∠ RNB    (Corresponding angles)⇒ b = c⇒ b = 80°

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure, line a || line b. line l is a transversal. Find the measures of ∠x, ∠y, ∠z using the given information.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure, line a || line b. line l is a transversal. Find the measures of ∠x, ∠y, ∠z using the given information.
subQuestion.ans: Let us mark the points A and B on l; K and M on a; L and N on b.Suppose KM and LN intersect AB at P and Q respectively.Since, a || b and l is a transversal, thenm∠ PQL = m∠ APK    (Corresponding angles)⇒ x = 105°Since AB and LN are straight lines that intersect at Q, thenm∠ BQN = m∠ PQL    (Vertically opposite angles)⇒ y = x⇒ y = 105°Since AB is a straight line and ray QN stands on it, thenm∠ BQN + m∠ PQN = 180°    (Angles in linear pair)⇒ y + m∠ PQN = 180°⇒ 105° + m∠ PQN = 180°⇒ m∠ PQN = 180° − 105°⇒ m∠ PQN = 75°Now, m∠ APM = m∠ PQN    (Corresponding angles)⇒ z = 75°

questions.questionsTitle: In the adjoining figure, line p || line l || line q.  Find ∠x with the help of the measures given in the figure.

subQuestion.question: In the adjoining figure, line p || line l || line q.  Find ∠x with the help of the measures given in the figure.
subQuestion.ans: Let us mark the points A, L and B on p; C, M and D on l; P, N and Q on q.Since, AB || CD and LM is a transversal intersecting AB at L and CD at M, thenm∠ LMD = ​m∠ ALM    (Alternate interior angles)⇒ m∠ LMD = 40°Since, CD || PQ and MN is a transversal intersecting CD at M and PQ at N, thenm∠ DMN = ​m∠ PNM    (Alternate interior angles)⇒ m∠ DMN = 30°Now, m∠ LMD + m∠ DMN = 40° + 30°⇒ m∠ LMN = 70°⇒ x = 70°

questions.questionsTitle: Point G is the centroid of  ABC.If l(RG) = 2.5 then l(GC) = ______.

subQuestion.question: Point G is the centroid of  ABC.
subQuestion.ans: If l(RG) = 2.5 then l(GC) =5.Explanation:In ∆ABC, the medians AP, BQ, and CR to the sides BC, CA, and AB respectively intersect at G.

subQuestion.question: If l(RG) = 2.5 then l(GC) = ______.
subQuestion.ans: Since then the centroid of a triangle divides the medians in the ratio of 2 : 1, then AG : GP = BG :GQ = CG : GR = 2 : 1We have, CG: GR = 2 : 1⇒ `("GC")/("RG") = 2/1`⇒ `("GC")/(2.5) = 2/1`⇒ GC = 5

questions.questionsTitle: Point G is the centroid of Δ ABC.If l(BG) = 6 then l(BQ) = ______.

subQuestion.question: Point G is the centroid of Δ ABC.
subQuestion.ans: If l(BG) = 6 then l(BQ) =9.Explanation:In ∆ABC, the medians AP, BQ and CR to the sides BC, CA and AB respectively intersect at G.

subQuestion.question: If l(BG) = 6 then l(BQ) = ______.
subQuestion.ans: Since, centroid of a triangle divides the medians in the ratio of 2 : 1, then AG : GP = BG : GQ = CG : GR = 2 : 1.We have BG : GQ = 2 : 1⇒ `("BG")/("GQ") = 2/1`⇒ `("BG")/("BQ" - "BG") = 2/1`⇒ `(6)/("BQ" - 6) = 2`⇒ BQ − 6 = 3⇒ BQ = 9

questions.questionsTitle: Point G is the centroid of Δ ABC.If l(AP) = 6 then l(AG) = ______ and l(GP) = ______.

subQuestion.question: Point G is the centroid of Δ ABC.
subQuestion.ans: If l(AP) = 6 then l(AG) =4and l(GP) =2.Explanation:In ∆ABC, the medians AP, BQ and CR to the sides BC, CA and AB respectively intersect at G.

subQuestion.question: If l(AP) = 6 then l(AG) = ______ and l(GP) = ______.
subQuestion.ans: Since, centroid of a triangle divides the medians in the ratio of 2 : 1, then AG : GP = BG : GQ = CG : GR = 2 : 1.We have, AG : GP = 2 : 1⇒ `("AG")/("GP") = 2/1`⇒ `("AG")/("AP" - "AG") = 2`⇒ `("AG")/(6 - "AG")` = 2⇒ 2(6 − AG) = AG⇒ 12 − 2AG = AG⇒ 3AG = 12⇒ `"AG" = 12/3`⇒ AG = 4

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{m^2 - n^2}{\left( m + n \right)^2} \times \frac{m^2 + mn + n^2}{m^3 - n^3}\]
subQuestion.ans: We know that,a3+ b3= (a + b)(a2− ab + b2)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)\[\frac{m^2 - n^2}{\left( m + n \right)^2} \times \frac{m^2 + mn + n^2}{m^3 - n^3}\]\[ = \frac{\left( m + n \right)\left( m - n \right)}{\left( m + n \right)\left( m + n \right)} \times \frac{\left( m^2 + mn + n^2 \right)}{\left( m - n \right)\left( m^2 + mn + n^2 \right)}\]\[= \frac{1}{m + n}\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{a^2 + 10a + 21}{a^2 + 6a - 7} \times \frac{a^2 - 1}{a + 3}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)\[\ \frac{a^2 + 10a + 21}{a^2 + 6a - 7} \times \frac{a^2 - 1}{a + 3}\]\[= \frac{a^2 + 7a + 3a + 21}{a^2 + 7a - a - 7} \times   \frac{\left(a + 1 \right)\left(a - 1 \right)}{\left(a + 3 \right)}\]\[= \frac{a\left(a + 7 \right) + 3\left(a + 7 \right)}{a \left(a + 7 \right) - 1\left(a + 7 \right)} \times \frac{\left(a + 1 \right)\left(a - 1 \right)}{\left(a + 3 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{\left(a + 7 \right)\left(a + 3 \right)}{\left(a - 1 \right)\left(a + 7 \right)} \times \frac{\left(a + 1 \right)\left(a - 1 \right)}{\left(a + 3 \right)}\]= (a + 1)

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{8 x^3 - 27 y^3}{4 x^2 - 9 y^2}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)\[\  \frac{8 x^3 - 27 y^3}{4 x^2 - 9 y^2}\]\[ = \frac{\left( 2x \right)^3 - \left( 3y \right)^3}{\left( 2x \right)^2 - \left( 3y \right)^2}\]\[ = \frac{\left( 2x - 3y \right)\left[ \left( 2x \right)^2 + \left( 2x \right) \times \left( 3y \right) + \left( 3y \right)^2 \right]}{\left( 2x + 3y \right)\left( 2x - 3y \right)}\]\[= \frac{\left(2x - 3y \right)\left(4 x^2 + 6xy + 9 y^2 \right)}{\left( 2x + 3y \right)\left(2x - 3y \right)}\]\[= \frac{4 x^2 + 6xy + 9 y^2}{\left(2x + 3y \right)}\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{x^2 - 5x - 24}{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x + 8 \right)} \times \frac{x^2 - 64}{\left( x - 8 \right)^2}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)\[\  \frac{x^2 - 5x - 24}{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x + 8 \right)} \times \frac{x^2 - 64}{\left( x - 8 \right)^2}\]\[ = \frac{x^2 - 8x + 3x - 24}{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x + 8 \right)} \times \frac{\left( x \right)^2 - \left( 8 \right)^2}{\left( x - 8 \right)^2}\]\[ = \frac{x\left( x - 8 \right) + 3\left( x - 8 \right)}{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x + 8 \right)} \times \frac{\left( x + 8 \right)\left( x - 8 \right)}{\left( x - 8 \right)\left( x - 8 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x - 8 \right)}{\left( x + 3 \right)\left( x + 8 \right)} \times \frac{\left( x + 8 \right)\left( x - 8 \right)}{\left( x - 8 \right)\left( x - 8 \right)}\]= 1

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:
Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{4 x^2 - 11x + 6}{16 x^2 - 9}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)\[\ \frac{4 x^2 - 11x + 6}{16 x^2 - 9}\]\[ = \frac{4 x^2 - 8x - 3x + 6}{\left(4x \right)^2 - \left(3 \right)^2}\]\[ = \frac{4x\left(x - 2 \right) - 3\left(x - 2 \right)}{\left(4x + 3 \right)\left(4x - 3 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{\left(4x - 3 \right)\left(x - 2 \right)}{\left(4x + 3 \right)\left( 4x - 3 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{x - 2}{4x + 3}\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{a^3 - 27}{5 a^2 - 16a + 3} \div \frac{a^2 + 3a + 9}{25 a^2 - 1}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)\[\  \frac{a^3 - 27}{5 a^2 - 16a + 3} \div \frac{a^2 + 3a + 9}{25 a^2 - 1}\]\[ = \frac{\left( a \right)^3 - \left(3 \right)^3}{5 a^2 - 15a - a + 3}   \div \frac{a^2 + 3a + 9}{\left( 5a \right)^2 - \left( 1 \right)^2}\]\[ = \frac{\left(a - 3 \right)\left\{ \left( a \right)^2 + \left(a \right) \times \left(3 \right) + \left(3 \right)^2 \right\}}{5a\left(a - 3 \right) - 1\left( a - 3 \right)} \div \frac{a^2 + 3a + 9}{\left(5a + 1 \right)\left(5a - 1 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{\left(a - 3 \right)\left(a^2 + 3a + 9 \right)}{\left(5a - 1 \right)\left(a - 3 \right)} \div \frac{\left( a^2 + 3a + 9 \right)}{\left(5a + 1 \right)\left(5a - 1 \right)}\]\[ = \frac{\left(a - 3 \right)\left(a^2 + 3a + 9 \right)}{\left(5a - 1 \right)\left(a - 3 \right)} \times \frac{\left(5a + 1 \right)\left(5a - 1 \right)}{\left(a^2 + 3a + 9 \right)}\]\[ = 5a + 1\]

questions.questionsTitle: Simplify:

subQuestion.question: \[\frac{1 - 2x + x^2}{1 - x^3} \times \frac{1 + x + x^2}{1 + x}\]
subQuestion.ans: It is known that,a2− b2= (a + b) (a − b)a3− b3= (a − b)(a2+ ab + b2)\[\  \frac{1 - 2x + x^2}{1 - x^3} \times \frac{1 + x + x^2}{1 + x}\]\[ = \frac{1 - x - x + x^2}{\left(1 \right)^3 - \left(x \right)^3} \times \frac{1 + x + x^2}{1 + x}\]\[ = \frac{1\left(1 - x \right) - x\left(1 - x \right)}{\left(1 - x \right)\left\{ \left(1 \right)^2 + \left(1 \right) \times \left( x \right) + \left(x \right)^2 \right\}}   \times   \frac{\left(1 + x + x^2 \right)}{1 + x}\]\[ = \frac{\left(1 - x \right)\left( 1 - x \right)}{\left(1 - x \right)\left(1 + x + x^2 \right)} \times \frac{\left(1 + x + x^2 \right)}{\left(1 + x \right)}\]\[ = \frac{1 - x}{1 + x}\]

questions.questionsTitle: If diagonal of a rectangle is 26 cm and one side is 24 cm, find the other side.

subQuestion.question: If diagonal of a rectangle is 26 cm and one side is 24 cm, find the other side.
subQuestion.ans: Suppose ABCD is a rectangle.Here, segment AC is a diagonal and segment AD is one side of the rectangle ABCD.l(AC) = 26 cm and l(AD) = 24 cm.In right ∆ACD,l(AC)2= l(AD)2+ l(CD)2...(Pythagoras theorem)⇒ l(CD)2= l(AC)2− l(AD)2⇒ l(CD)2= (26)2− (24)2⇒ l(CD)2= 676 − 576 = 100⇒ l(CD)=  `sqrt(100)` = 10 cmThus, the other side of the rectangle is 10 cm.

questions.questionsTitle: Lengths of diagonals of a rhombus ABCD are 16 cm and 12 cm. Find the side and perimeter of the rhombus.

subQuestion.question: Lengths of diagonals of a rhombus ABCD are 16 cm and 12 cm. Find the side and perimeter of the rhombus.
subQuestion.ans: ABCD is a rhombus.Here, segment AC and segment BD are the diagonals of the rhombus ABCD.l(AC) = 16 cm and l(BD) = 12 cm.Diagonals of a rhombus are perpendicular bisectors of each other.∴ m∠AOD = 90°Also, l(OA) = `1/2l(AC) = 1/2 xx 16 = 8  cm`l(OD) = `1/2l(BD) = 1/2`× 12 = 6 cmIn right ∆AOD,l(AD)2= l(OA)2+ l(OD)2...[Pythagoras theorem]⇒ l(AD)2= (8)2+ (6)2⇒ l(AD)2= 64 + 36 = 100⇒ l(AD)= \[\sqrt{100}\] = 10 cmAll sides of a rhombus are equal.∴ Perimeter of the rhombus ABCD = 4 × Side of a rhombus = 4 × 10 = 40 cmThus, the side and perimeter of the rhombus are 10 cm and 40 cm, respectively.

questions.questionsTitle: Find the length of diagonal of a square with side 8 cm.

subQuestion.question: Find the length of diagonal of a square with side 8 cm.
subQuestion.ans: Suppose ABCD is a square of side 8 cm.Here, segment AC is a diagonal of square ABCD.In ∆ABC,l(AC)2= l(AB)2+ l(BC)2...(Pythagoras theorem)⇒ l(AC)2= (8)2+ (8)2⇒ l(AC)2= 64 + 64 = 128⇒ l(AC)= \[\sqrt{128}\] cm        …[Taking square root of both sides]⇒ l(AC)= \[\sqrt{64 × 2}\] cm⇒ l(AC)= 8\[\sqrt{2}\] cmThus, the length of diagonal of square is 8\[\sqrt{2}\] cm.

questions.questionsTitle: Measure of one angle of a rhombus is 50°, find the measures of remaining three angles.

subQuestion.question: Measure of one angle of a rhombus is 50°, find the measures of remaining three angles.
subQuestion.ans: Suppose ABCD is a rhombus.Let m∠A = 50ºOpposite angles of a rhombus are congruentes.∴ m∠C = m∠A = 50º and m∠B = m∠DNow,m∠A + m∠B + m∠C + m∠D = 360º∴ 50º + m∠B + 50º + m∠D = 360º⇒ m∠B + m∠D = 360º − 100º = 260º⇒ 2 m∠B = 260º   ...(m∠B = m∠D)⇒ m∠B = `(260°)/2` = 130°∴ m∠D = m∠B = 130ºThus, the measures of the remaining angles of the rhombus are 130º, 50º, and 130º.

questions.questionsTitle: Measures of opposite angles of a parallelogram are (3x − 2)° and (50 − x)°. Find the measure of its each angle.

subQuestion.question: Measures of opposite angles of a parallelogram are (3x − 2)° and (50 − x)°. Find the measure of its each angle.
subQuestion.ans: Let ABCD be the parallelogram.Suppose ∠A = (3x − 2)º and ∠C = (50 − x)º.We know that the opposite angles of a paralelogram are congruentes.∴ m∠A = m∠C⇒ 3x − 2 = 50 − x⇒ 3x + x = 50 + 2⇒ 4x = 52⇒ x = `52/4`⇒ x = 13∴ m∠A = (3x − 2)º = (3 × 13 − 2)º = (39 − 2)​º = 37ºSo, m∠C = m∠A = 37ºAlso, the adjacent angles of a parallelogram are supplementary.∴ m∠A + m∠D = 180º⇒ 37º + m∠D = 180º⇒ m∠D = 180º − 37º = 143ºNow,m∠B = m∠D = 143º               (Opposite angles of a parallelogram are congruent)Thus, the measure of the angles of the parallelogram are 37º, 143º, 37º and 143º.

subQuestion.ans: WXYZ is a parallelogram.(1)l(XY) = l(WZ) = 4.5 cm    ...(Opposite sides of a parallelogram are congruent)(2)l(XW) = l(YZ) = 8.2 cm    ...(Opposite sides of a parallelogram are congruent)(3)l(OZ) = l(OX) = 2.5 cm    ...(Diagonals of parallelogram bisect each other)(4)l(WY) = 2 × l(WO) = 2 × 3.3 = 6.6 cm    ...(Diagonals of parallelogram bisect each other)(5)m∠WXY = m∠WZY = 120º    ...(Opposite angles of a parallelogram are congruent)Now,m∠WZY + m∠XWZ = 180º    ...(Adjacent angles of a parallelogram are supplementary)⇒ 120º + m∠XWZ = 180º⇒ m∠XWZ = 180º − 120º = 60º

questions.questionsTitle: Ratio of consecutive angles of a quadrilateral is 1 : 2 : 3 : 4. Find the measure of its each angle. Write, with reason, what type of a quadrilateral it is.

subQuestion.question: Ratio of consecutive angles of a quadrilateral is 1 : 2 : 3 : 4. Find the measure of its each angle. Write, with reason, what type of a quadrilateral it is.
subQuestion.ans: Suppose PQRS is a quadrilateral.Let m∠P : m∠Q : m∠R : m∠S = 1 : 2 : 3 : 4So, m∠P = k, m∠Q = 2k, m∠R = 3k and m∠S = 4k, where k is some constantNow,m∠P + m∠Q  + m∠R + m∠S = 360°∴ k + 2k + 3k + 4k = 360°⇒ 10k = 360°⇒ k = 36°∴ m∠P = 36°m∠Q = 2k = 2 × 36° = 72°m∠R = 3k = 3 × 36° = 108°m∠S = 4k = 4 × 36° = 144°Now,  m∠P + m∠S = 36° + 144° = 180°We know if two lines are intersected by a transversal such that the sum of interior angles on the same transversal is supplementary, then the two lines are parallel.∴ Side PQ || Side SRAlso, m∠P + m∠Q = 36° + 72° = 108° ≠ 180°So, side PS is not parallel to side QR.In quadrilateral PQRS, only one pair of opposite sides is parallel.

questions.questionsTitle: Divide. Write the quotient and the remainder.

subQuestion.question: (2y3+ 4y2+ 3) ÷ 2y2
subQuestion.ans: (2y3+ 4y2+ 3) ÷ 2y2= \[\frac{2 y^3 + 4 y^2 + 3}{2 y^2}\]= \[\frac{2 y^2 \left( y + 2 \right) + 3}{2 y^2}\]= \[\frac{2 y^2 \left( y + 2 \right)}{2 y^2} + \frac{3}{2 y^2}\]= \[\left( y + 2 \right) + \frac{3}{2 y^2}\]So, quotient = \[\left(y + 2 \right)\] and remainder = 3

subQuestion.question: 17p − 2 = 49
subQuestion.ans: 17p − 2 = 49Adding 2 to both sides⇒ 17p − 2 + 2 = 49 + 2⇒ 17p = 51Dividing both sides by 17⇒ `(17"p")/17 = 51/17`⇒ p = 3Hence, p = 3 is the solution of the equation.
